
Intercepted message encrypted with RSA using a careless modulus: both primes are Blum integers. Can you exploit this to recover the flag? Ciphertext: 4570802596620351280761726543061633664935436646754780744958894168624680138011073763193526705899677854229084130154069785426233709464178677403423168431352311


The flag format is flag{...}
n=5846214116818951695866038708090207276636336949021011511440031699127017438450233825958167838786026272814445538289096687746661862874022382742027427085899717, e=3882416437608076125985557164672312282773242020183544547985110054595956573873995272764421493762887223434398990750917622419213749744706730268191506625461703
The lower 104 bits of p are: 50916726074897510025157249611204598847


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{fqh4c9ya}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 4570802596620351280761726543061633664935436646754780744958894168624680138011073763193526705899677854229084130154069785426233709464178677403423168431352311
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5846214116818951695866038708090207276636336949021011511440031699127017438450233825958167838786026272814445538289096687746661862874022382742027427085899717, e=3882416437608076125985557164672312282773242020183544547985110054595956573873995272764421493762887223434398990750917622419213749744706730268191506625461703
The lower 104 bits of p are: 50916726074897510025157249611204598847

extra_info: p=69415981762691673520893620601147152949630168563267139654613949296405212240959, q=84220001912600752458021292121953038231459920396371712594177573124678883072763, Ï†(n)=5846214116818951695866038708090207276636336949021011511440031699127017438450080189974492546360047357901722438097915597657702224021773591219606342990585996
